title: Harry Kane makes one demand to Daniel Levy ahead of possible summer exit
body_text:
Tottenham Hotspur salvaged a point against fellow top-four hopefuls Manchester United on Thursday night.
After suffering an embarrassing 6-1 defeat against Newcastle United last weekend, interim manager Ryan Mason was tasked with getting a strong reaction out of his squad, and although the Lilywhites went into the half-time break two-nil down against United, a positive second half saw the Londoners forge a comeback.
However, despite the good result which keeps Spurs in contention to qualify for next seasonâ€™s Champions League, there remains huge uncertainty over the future of record goalscorer Harry Kane, who has just one year left on his contract.
Heavily linked with a move away from Spurs in the summer in search of major silverware, the England international is rumoured to top Erik Ten Hagâ€™s wishlist (The Athletic).
And with the travelling fans heard singing â€˜Harry Kane, weâ€™ll see you in Juneâ€™ during Thursdayâ€™s match, it is clear the 30-year-old has the United-faithfulâ€™s approval.

Set for an important summer, which will likely determine where he spends the rest of his career, according to a report from Football Insider, Kane has told his clubâ€™s board that he wants to have a say in who the sideâ€™s next permanent is.
Although no names have been mentioned at this stage, Kane is believed to want a very â€˜attack-mindedâ€™ coach to be the one to succeed Antonio Conte on a permanent basis.
